RT @MedpageOnco: Adding this to rituximab reduced the risk of disease progression or death for patients with relapsed indolent non-Hodgkin'
RT @ASCOPost: Matthew J. Matasar, MD, on Indolent NHL: New Data on Copanlisib Plus Rituximab https://t.co/cSkqCb2h2A #lymsm #hematology #AA

@DrPaulyDeSantis @Hieflo23 Again, cross-trial comparisons and all that, but nearly identical median pfs vs augment when using investigator assessed PFS (25m in AUGMENT). That said, different tox profiles, OOP costs, schedules will likely make one or the other more attractive for a given pt
@YLeyfman Thanks for the kind words Yan!
@EmilyMcMack @AACR Not just because...but especially because!
@DrAEvens Well, cross trial comparisons and all that, but CHRONOS1 had copanlisib mono ORR 60 mPFS 12m, so combo probably > copa mono in ritux sensitive relapsed iNHL
@LYM_MM_CONNECT Most pneumonitis gr1-2 in severity, <3% had grade 3+ pneumonitis.

@bpromd Patients in CHRONOS-3 were rituximab sensitive. The purpose of the study was to evaluate, in patients for whom rituximab monotherapy would be appropriate, if R+copanlisib would be more effective and safe.
@Gritsman_lab @TheLancetOncol @AACR Thanks Kira! Were all trying to translate the work by smart scientists like you!
@fieldstonegirl @TheLancetOncol @AACR Thanks Rose! The thanks always truly goes to our patients, and their trust and confidence in us to work together to keep them healthy.

@TheJeffBridges Wishing you speedy healing! Im sure youve got access to good care, but just in case: have your pathology reviewed by an expert hematopathologist, and consider a second opinion (even if youve had to start treatment quickly, there may be tweaks you could benefit from)

Seeing my kid, whoa a highschool sophomore and decided to spend their summer learning about dark matter (thanks COVID), email senior astrophysics faculty asking for pdfs or clarifications - and how quickly and respectfully they responded - gives me hope for academia.

@chadinabhan Props to @yungposu who taught me this fine piece of history/trivia my first week of fellowship, back when roamed the

@chadinabhan Depends on definitions: Seaweed to treat goiter = 2700 bce. Iodine discovered around 1800. Radium into thyroid glad ~1910. Idea of Rai in the 1930s, first used for Graves 1941. First report of Rai treating thyroid ca 1948 (first use of targeted cancer therapy)
@chadinabhan I believe the answer is 131-I for thyroid cancer, 1971?
@DannyVietti Sweet Lou Whitaker
